intro: Cryptandra exilis, commonly known as the slender cryptandra, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of pink or white flowers. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open woodlands or heathlands. Cryptandra exilis is an important component of the local flora and is adapted to the region's dry climate.
